name: Fields of View 02
description:
This work uses a creative process of applying transformations to certain layers and manipulating the features in an image generation model.

A method known as network bending [1].
[1] https://github.com/terrybroad/network-bending
There is a perceived acceptance of imagery when presented in emotive material forms such as 35mm film. Film is a connection to lived experiences that we can subjectively relate to in the pastoral nature of sky and mountains. Whereas it is in tension with the more clinical nature of data and our acknowledgement of place as a political entity.
The intrinsic, tangible quality of celluloid film and paper print play to our sentimental memory bias making it harder to distinguish between what is real or fake. We take on the role of a neural network predicting the extent of ambiguity. 
In the 'Fields of View' series, the dataset is derived of digitally scanned 35mm film slides depicting landscapes captured on family holidays. Features of similarity to sky and mountain terrain have been transformed and manipulated to create these visual outcomes. By transforming and manipulating certain features in the model the work makes comparison to historic in-camera editing techniques of cameraless film making.
